com.planbase.pdf.layoutmanager

Interface Renderable

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Cell, ScaledJpeg, ScaledPng, TableBuilder, Text

    public interface Renderable
    Implementing Renderable means being suitable for use with a two-pass layout manager whose first pass says, "given this width, what is your height?" and second pass says, "Given these dimensions, draw yourself as best you can."

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      XyDim calcDimensions(float maxWidth)
      Given a width, returns the height and actual width after line wrapping.
      XyOffset render(LogicalPage lp, XyOffset outerTopLeft, XyDim outerDimensions, boolean allPages)
      Only call this with a maxWidth that you have previously passed to calcDimensions.

    • Method Detail

      • calcDimensions

        XyDim calcDimensions(float maxWidth)
        Given a width, returns the height and actual width after line wrapping. If line wrapping is not needed, just returns the static width and height. If calculations are done, the results should be cached because render() will likely be called with the same width (or at least one previously given widths).

      • render

        XyOffset render(LogicalPage lp,
                XyOffset outerTopLeft,
                XyDim outerDimensions,
                boolean allPages)
        Only call this with a maxWidth that you have previously passed to calcDimensions. Renders item and all child-items with given width and returns the x-y pair of the lower-right-hand corner of the last line (e.g. of text).
